nodes.bodyText: Whoops! I thought I had removed this openshift.json file back when I deleted OpenShift stuff in e72ba3c. I say we remove this file too, either in this pull request or in a future one. We aren't using it. We aren't maintaining it.

nodes.bodyText: We don't use this anymore? I assume it's being deleted on purpose. 😄

I was having to submit a PR and wait on the review process each time someone requested a new feature and accompanying group_var in dataverse-ansible. Since this file only applied beneath the dataverse-ansible role, I moved it there. Let me know if this should be removed in a separate issue.
No, it's fine. Thanks.
Mental note: Vagrant was already upgraded to CentOS 8 in pull request #7153 (also by @donsizemore , thank you!).
Since we're creating this new c8.dockerfile, should we go ahead and delete the c7.dockerfile in this directory?
It might be useful for testing on cent7 and cent8; but that's probably better handled through dataverse-ansible.
I removed the old one. We can always pull it out of git history if we need it.
Should we delete c6client.dockerfile since we're adding c8client.dockerfile?
Probably - seems like it's less confusing to have two copies.
In the end we decided to stick with the older, already tested version of CentOS for DCM stuff.

Just a comment that it's sad to see "the steps below were orginally[sic] written for el6" in here. I'm not sure if the steps need to be rewritten or not. People would probably complain if they don't work. Maybe we should rewrite this line.
